To clean hardwood floors, start by sweeping them with a broom or vacuum cleaner to remove dirt and debris. Then, mop the floors using a damp mop and a mild detergent, rinsing the mop with clean water after each pass. Finally, dry the floors with a clean towel or cloth.

To clean hardwood floors, use a vacuum or broom to sweep away dirt and debris. Mop the floor with a damp mop and a mild cleaner or a mixture of warm water and dish soap. Dry the floor with a clean cloth or towel.
